message: Lol not my 7 year old...or my 8 year old. I teach my children and grandchildren to listen, research and think about not just themselves but what us in everyone's best interest. I want my kids to be happy and thoughtful. I am Christian. My youngest son believes in a higher power. He don't agree with me on a lot of things but that is OK. I respect his views. Not everyone will agree with my thinking. I respect that.. We all have a different journey in life we make different decisions based on our beliefs.... God bless

The taps were not ilegal. They were all approved by the justice, the process was running in secret to avoid interference, but once Lula was nominated minister, government manoeuvre to avoid his prosecution, The judge, through legal means, declared the process as public And legally exposed all evidence. If you were a lawyer, a good one, if you had studied law in Brazil you would know that! I remind you Latin countries legal system follow the Romam law, different from what happens in UK and US. And you are also wrong about Brazilians, all we want is all corrupted people to pay for their crimes. Mas vc e brasileiro e entende bem portugues, esta defendendo bandido, quem defende o Lula hoje vai acabar defendendo Aecio amanha! Quem anda com porcos farelos come! Lula e ladrao e ha mil provas quanto a isso! Acorda petista!!!
